name: yocto-bitbake
description: Extended Yocto Project and BitBake language support

bitbake.loggingLevel.markdownDescription: Adjust the logging level: `error` for reporting only errors, `info` for displaying information useful to the user, and `debug` for the same information as `info,` but with additional debugging details.

bitbake.parseOnSave.description: Activate parsing on save. When a recipe is saved, bitbake will automatically be run to parse it.

bitbake.eSDKMode.deprecationMessage: eSDK mode is now automatically detected. This setting is deprecated and will be removed in a future release.
bitbake.eSDKMode.markdownDescription: Activate eSDK only mode. This tells the extension that devtool is available but not bitbake, which will disable unavailable features. You should point the `bitbake.pathToEnvScript` setting to the environment script of the eSDK.

bitbake.pathToEnvScript.markdownDescription:
Set the path to the environment script to configure the BitBake project. _(Optional)_, see the commandWrapper setting.

Example: `${workspaceFolder}/sources/poky/oe-init-build-env`

bitbake.pathToBuildFolder.description:
Set the build folder for the BitBake project. _(Optional)_, see the commandWrapper setting.

Example: '${workspaceFolder}/build'

bitbake.pathToBitbakeFolder.description: Set the path to the BitBake folder. Used to provide Python embedded language features.

bitbake.commandWrapper.markdownDescription:
An optional build tool command to wrap around BitBake commands.

Various tools provide ways to automatically configure the BitBake environment, or even call it inside containers. This option allows you to use them through this extension by wrapping around the bitbake invocation.

The resulting commands generated by this extension will be for example:

 `$ <commandWrapper> 'bitbake core-image-minimal'`

 `$ <commandWrapper> '. <pathToEnvScript> <pathToBuildFolder> && bitbake core-image-minimal'`

See examples:

`docker run --rm -v ${workspaceFolder}:${workspaceFolder} crops/poky --workdir=${workspaceFolder} /bin/bash -c`

`kas shell -c`

`cqfd run`

`${workspaceFolder}/build.sh --`

Note: Relative paths must be relative to the workingDirectory folder, where the command will be run.

bitbake.workingDirectory.description: Set the working directory for running BitBake command.

bitbake.shellEnv.description: Environment variables to set before running the BitBake command.

bitbake.sshTarget.markdownDescription:
Hostname or IP address of the SSH target for deploying recipes or SDK builds to a remote target. _(Optional)_

Example: `root@192.168.0.50`

Additional SSH options must be defined through your SSH configuration file (`~/.ssh/config`).

bitbake.sdkImage.markdownDescription:
SDK image to use for cross-compilation and debugging.

Example: `core-image-minimal`

bitbake.disableEmbeddedLanguagesFiles.markdownDescription: Disables temporary files generated for BitBake's embedded languages. This action will turn off most features within Shell and Python regions of BitBake code. This is intended for users who don't want temporary files to be saved on their drive, or do not want to see the diagnostics of these temporary files polluting their 'PROBLEMS' tab. Please note a reload of VS Code might be required after activating or deactivating this setting for the full change to take effect.

bitbake.buildConfigurations.description: Array of alternative configurations for starting bitbake. It can be useful to handle multiple build folders for multiple targets (MACHINE configurations). If an option is not defined, the value from the main configuration will be used.

pathToEnvScript.markdownDescription: Sub-configuration specific setting to replace the main `pathToEnvScript`. See the `bitbake.pathToEnvScript` setting.

pathToBuildFolder.markdownDescription: Sub-configuration specific setting to replace the main `pathToBuildFolder`. See the `bitbake.pathToBuildFolder` setting.

commandWrapper.markdownDescription: Sub-configuration specific setting to replace the main `commandWrapper`. See the `bitbake.commandWrapper` setting.

workingDirectory.markdownDescription: Sub-configuration specific setting to replace the main `workingDirectory`. See the `bitbake.workingDirectory` setting.

shellEnv.markdownDescription: Sub-configuration specific setting to replace the main `shellEnv`. See the `bitbake.shellEnv` setting.

sshTarget.markdownDescription: Sub-configuration specific setting to replace the main `sshTarget`. See the `bitbake.sshTarget` setting.

sdkImage.markdownDescription: Sub-configuration specific setting to replace the main `sdkImage`. See the `bitbake.sdkImage` setting.

bitbake.disableConfigModification.description: Turn on this setting to stop this extension from modifying the VS Code configuration of the workspace. Note that this will also disable some features related to embedded Python and Shell code.

task.description: Bitbake task to run (build by default)

options.description: Additional options to pass to the bitbake command

continue.description: Continue as much as possible after an error (-k)

force.description: Force the specified targets/task to run (-f).

specialCommand.description: Special command to run instead of bitbake. Intended for internal use by the extension.

pattern.regexp: (ERROR): (.+): (Error in compiling python function) in (.*), line (\d+):$

commands.title: BitBake: Rescan Project
commands.description: This command rescans the bitbake project.

commands.title: BitBake: Change active buildConfiguration
commands.description: Select the active build configuration from the settings to use for bitbake commands.

commands.title: BitBake: Build recipe
commands.description: Build a recipe or an image.

commands.title: BitBake: Clean recipe
commands.description: Clean a recipe or an image (bitbake -c clean).

commands.title: BitBake: Run task for recipe
commands.description: Run a specific task for a bitbake recipe.

commands.title: BitBake: Scan Recipe
commands.description: Run 'bitbake -e' on the chosen recipe to improve the language services such as hover definition

commands.title: BitBake: Scan global environment
commands.description: Run 'bitbake -e' for the global environment to improve the language features such as hover definition on conf files

commands.title: BitBake: Open recipe's workdir
commands.description: Open a recipe's workdir in VSCode.

commands.title: BitBake: Drop a recipe from the active workspace
commands.description: Stop watching or suggesting a recipe in bitbake commands.

commands.title: BitBake: Add a recipe to the active workspace
commands.description: Start watching or suggesting a recipe in bitbake commands.

commands.title: BitBake: Drop all recipes from the active workspace
commands.description: Clear all recipes in the recipes view and from all command suggestions.

commands.title: BitBake: Parse all recipes
commands.description: This command runs bitbake in parse-only mode.

commands.title: BitBake: Start toaster in browser
commands.description: Start Toaster and reveal it in the browser.

commands.title: BitBake: Stop Toaster
commands.description: This stops Toaster by running `source toaster stop`.

commands.title: BitBake: Clear workspace State
commands.description: This clears all the data stored in the workspace state which would persist between sessions. This can potentially solve the crash caused by downgrading the extension to a version that is not able to handle the new workspace state data format.

commands.title: BitBake: Examine recipe's dependencies with taskexp
commands.description: Examine the recipe's dependencies with taskexp.

commands.title: BitBake: Devtool: Modify recipe
commands.description: Open a new devtool workspace to modify a recipe's sources.

commands.title: BitBake: Devtool: Configure VSCode SDK
commands.description: Configure a devtool sources' workspace for cross-compilation and debugging.

commands.title: BitBake: Devtool: Configure devtool SDK fallback
commands.description: Configure a devtool sources' workspace to use `devtool build` and `devtool deploy-target` if `devtool ide-sdk` is not available.

commands.title: BitBake: Devtool: Open Workspace
commands.description: Open a devtool sources workspace in a new VSCode window.

commands.title: BitBake: Devtool: Reset
commands.description: Remove a devtool workspace.

commands.title: BitBake: Devtool: Update recipe
commands.description: Update a recipe from a devtool workspace's modifications.

commands.title: Bitbake: Devtool: Build recipe
commands.description: Build a recipe through devtool.

commands.title: Bitbake: Devtool: Deploy recipe
commands.description: Deploy a devtool package on an SSH target.

commands.title: BitBake: Devtool: Clean recipe
commands.description: Clean a recipe using devtool.

commands.title: BitBake: Open interactive terminal
commands.description: Open an interactive terminal with the bitbake environment.

commands.title: BitBake: Open recipe's devshell
commands.description: Open an interactive BitBake devshell for a recipe.

commands.title: BitBake: Collapse list
commands.description: Collapse the focused list of recipes or devtool workspaces.

scripts.postinstall: cd server && npm install && cd ../client && npm install && cd ..
scripts.fetch: npm run fetch:poky && npm run fetch:docs && npm run fetch:wasm && npm run fetch:spdx-licenses
scripts.vscode:prepublish: cd server && npm install --omit=dev && cd ../client && npm install --omit=dev && cd ..
scripts.clean: npm run clean:lib && npm run clean:server && npm run clean:client && rm -fr node_modules integration-tests/out integration-tests/project-folder/build* .vscode-test .eslintcache resources coverage ./out *.vsix tsconfig.tsbuildinfo
scripts.test: npm run jest && npm run test:integration && npm run test:grammar
scripts.dev:vsix: npm run clean && npm install && npm run fetch:wasm && npm run fetch:docs && npm run fetch:spdx-licenses && npm run compile && npm run package
scripts.dev:npm: npm run clean && npm install && npm run fetch:wasm && npm run fetch:docs && npm run fetch:spdx-licenses && cd server && npm pack
